title: Please add Kayn to the Blood Moon list

replies.body:
The problem is how much sustain Rhast has, which will be the form you'll use 9/10 times in that mode.
Unless of course they disable Rhast, which I doubt they'll do.

Found the person who doesn't play {{champion:141}}

Your statement has 0 logic behind it to counteract what I said.

Shadow Assassin in the preferred form yes, but in Blood Moon most champions are melee so you'll end up with Darkin form as opposed to Shadow Assassin that requires ranged champions to instantly transform into. To use Shadow Assassin in Blood Moon you'd have to be in basic Kayn form for far too long compared to how long those matches last, quite possibly the game ending before you even get the chance to wait out the timer to use Shadow Assassin.

Rhast has too much sustain for him to be healthy for the mode, which is why Riot did not add Kayn to the list to begin with. They'll have to disable Darkin in order to use Kayn.

Riot said if they added him they'd disable Darkin, also darkin kayn would be shit in that mode, sustain is countered by burst, and he cant build tank due to the item limits, so he'll get bursted down before he can heal.

The reason they didn't include Kayn in the first place was because Rhaast would break the gamemode. They said something about adding Kayn if they developed a way to force him into Shadow Assassin form.
At least someone that understands and remembers why Riot didn't add him to the mode already, thank you.
Not to mention he'd be a big liability to his team until he could transform.

They said the only reason he wasn't in the last Blood Moon was because he was relatively new and that he was 100% going to be on the next one, but with some tweaks to his passive (either he starts blue form or he only gains blue points but really quick).  
https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/6vczmv/kayn_should_be_on_the_blood_moon_mode/dlzanfn/
